sub_title: English language editor of the International Journal of Biology at University of Istanbul
summary:
Born in Middlesbrough, in the north riding of Yorkshire. Later attempts to create Teeside, Cleveland and what have you, outside Yorkshire, do not alter the original fact. Attended the Roman Catholic Cathedral school "over the border" as they called it; a tough part of town with a sense of "disorder".
11+ led me to St Mary's College run by a teaching order of priests (Marists not Marxists!) and from then on down to London and beyond.
Everybody called my Irish mother "Babs".....

Red hair, Irish rose,
Mothercare,
Ancient pose.
Gaelic tune,,
Wizard rune,
Guiness & gin
Blues bottled within.

Mushroom lady,
Made very tasty gravy,
Irish export,
Now and then a glass of port.
Battling Babs behind the bar,
Unkown human star.

My dad was a piano playing steelworker who could make a pub really rock to Winifred Atwell.
Would have been a concert pianist, he said, had he not lost a piece of his little finger on his left hand in the "works".
